articles.headline: Don’t Like the Dancing Cowboys? Results Say You Do
articles.snippet: The surprising success of the ubiquitous Web banners by LowerMyBills.com has led to a significant payday for the company.
articles.abstract: The surprising success of the ubiquitous Web banners by LowerMyBills.com has led to a significant payday for the company.
articles.lead_paragraph: Most online advertisements are becoming less obtrusive and more tailored to the interests of individual Web users. Among the stubborn holdouts are the two-stepping cowboys, frisky rooftop dancers and weird tattoos in ubiquitous Web banners from LowerMyBills.com.

articles.headline: Rivals Offer $38 Billion for a REIT
articles.snippet: The $38 billion offer has set off the biggest buyout battle since the landmark fight for RJR Nabisco nearly two decades ago.
articles.abstract: The $38 billion offer has set off the biggest buyout battle since the landmark fight for RJR Nabisco nearly two decades ago.
articles.lead_paragraph: The gloves have come off in buyouts.
articles.byline: By Andrew Ross Sorkin and Terry Pristin

articles.headline: Shiite Fighters Are Arrested, Iraq Says
articles.snippet: Several dozen arrests mark the first time the Shiite government had claimed significant action against the Mahdi Army militia.
articles.abstract: Several dozen arrests mark the first time the Shiite government had claimed significant action against the Mahdi Army militia.
articles.lead_paragraph: BAGHDAD, Jan. 17 — Facing intense pressure from the Bush administration to show progress in securing Iraq, senior Iraqi officials announced Wednesday that they had moved against the country’s most powerful Shiite militia, arresting several dozen senior members in the past few weeks.

articles.headline: Purging Bloat to Fashion Sleek Software
articles.snippet: After a radical redesign, Microsoft's Word, Excel and PowerPoint applications are almost totally new programs.
articles.abstract: After a radical redesign, Microsoft's Word, Excel and PowerPoint applications are almost totally new programs.
articles.lead_paragraph: Life has a funny symmetry, don’t you think? When you’re born, you’re short, toothless and bald. You spend the first part of your life gaining height, teeth and hair — and the last part losing them again.

articles.headline: Fraternal Twins in the Showroom
articles.snippet: Foreign carmakers are offering look-alike models at the high and low ends of their respective brands that may cause some unintended double-takes.
articles.abstract: Foreign carmakers are offering look-alike models at the high and low ends of their respective brands that may cause some unintended double-takes.
articles.lead_paragraph: DETROIT, Jan. 17 — Inside the cavernous Cobo Convention Center where the Detroit auto show is held each year, it’s easy to lose your way among the hundreds of new models.

articles.headline: Two Seek Large Stake in Tribune
articles.snippet: Eli Broad and Ronald W. Burkle made a $500 million offer to become the largest shareholder in the Tribune Company.
articles.abstract: Eli Broad and Ronald W. Burkle made a $500 million offer to become the largest shareholder in the Tribune Company.
articles.lead_paragraph: As the deadline for bids for the Tribune Company came and went yesterday, the team of Eli Broad and Ronald W. Burkle made an audacious $500 million offer to help refinance the company while becoming its largest shareholder.
articles.byline: By Katharine Q. Seelye and Andrew Ross Sorkin
